title: Watch: Moment Sunita Williams' craft made spectacular splashdown on Earth
content: Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams safely returned to Earth after an unexpected nine-month stay on the ISS due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner crew capsule. They were brought back by SpaceX, which faced its own delays. During their extended mission, they completed crucial experiments and spacewalks, setting records and garnering prayers and support from the American public.

title: Putin agrees to limit Ukraine attacks but with conditions - Key points
content: United States President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin have agreed on the necessity for a ceasefire and peace in the Ukraine conflict. Their nearly two-hour conversation included discussions on improving US-Russia relations and avoiding future conflicts, with initial steps comprising ceasefires in energy, infrastructure, and maritime operations in the Black Sea.

title: How have IPL franchises evolved for choice of captains
content: In the evolution of IPL captains, teams now prefer strategic leaders over mere brand icons. Stars like Shane Warne in the past and Shreyas Iyer currently combined tactical acumen with on-field performance. Modern IPL teams focus on players prominent in the playing XI, irrespective of their presence or not in the national T20I team, emphasizing performance and leadership skills.

title: Buy or sell: Stocks on brokerages’ radar for today
content: Analysts have maintained 'buy' ratings on pharmaceuticals, steel, and financial stocks, expecting profitable growth. Akums Drugs aims to boost margins, JSW Steel foresees strong demand and price benefits, and Bajaj Finserv's fundamentals remain intact post-split with Allianz. Va Tech Wabag and Baazar Style Retail see robust growth potential.

title: Elon Musk names Jeff Bezos & Google, Oracle founders as smartest people he knows
content: Elon Musk praised several tech leaders including Larry Ellison, Larry Page, and Jeff Bezos for their intelligence and achievements. Despite Musk and Bezos' past rivalry, their relationship appears to be improving, notably highlighted by Musk's recent memes suggesting reconciliation.

title: Proposed H-1B wage hike may hurt hiring of freshers, scientists, engineers
content: Proposed wage mandates for H-1B visa holders, including a requirement to pay at least the median local wage, may hinder US companies from hiring skilled foreign workers, warns an NFAP study. These mandates could force employers to move jobs offshore, particularly affecting recent graduates in science and engineering, and could weaken the US workforce in key technology sectors.

title: Don't arm 'terror sponsor' Pakistan, India tells Netherlands
content: India urged the Netherlands to restrict arms and military technology sales to Pakistan due to its history of sponsoring cross-border terrorism. During a high-level meeting, India highlighted that arming Pakistan undermines regional security and emphasized opportunities for collaboration in shipbuilding, AI, and defense technology research.

title: Builders, contractors must give 'no Bangladeshi' undertaking: Maha govt
content: Maharashtra's government requires developers and contractors in Mumbai to ensure they do not employ Bangladeshis and to report any presence to the police. This directive is planned for Navi Mumbai next. The state has arrested and deported a historical number of Bangladeshis but faces difficulties due to lack of cooperation from Bengal regarding documents.

title: JP Morgan CEO to Stanford University students: I don’t defend your right to...
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has mandated five days of office work starting this month, asserting it is the best way to run the company. Dimon highlighted the importance of in-person work for learning, innovation, and company culture, emphasizing its criticality for younger employees and managerial communication.

title: 'Hamas responsible for this war': Netanyahu after renewed Gaza attacks
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blamed Hamas for the renewed violence, defending Israel's military operations in Gaza. Netanyahu asserted efforts were made to avoid conflict, but Hamas rejected truce proposals, prompting the offensive. The recent strikes reportedly killed 404 Palestinians and wounded over 560, escalating the conflict further.

title: MHA refuses to share Kumbh stampede data, says such info not Centre's domain
content: The home ministry stated it does not maintain data on fatalities and injuries from the stampede at Maha Kumbh mela, as such incidents fall under state jurisdiction. The ministry shared that religious event management and disaster response are state responsibilities, and no central data is available.

title: China’s BYD Unveils 5-Minute Tech, Challenging Tesla
content: BYD has introduced a new electric vehicle (EV) charging technology that can fully charge a car in 5-8 minutes. This breakthrough could challenge Tesla's market position. BYD's new system offers up to 470 kilometers of range in 5 minutes. This innovation highlights the company's commitment to addressing charging time concerns in the EV market.

title: Trump says 'working quickly to have complete ceasefire' after call with Putin
content: US President Donald Trump held a productive call with Russian President Vladimir Putin, agreeing on an immediate ceasefire on strikes in Ukraine. The brief ceasefire is seen as a critical initial move towards broader peace talks, though full ceasefire terms are still under negotiation.

title: Trump and Putin discusses potential NHL-KHL Hockey matchup
content: Former U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin recently discussed a potential hockey showdown between NHL and KHL players. However, the NHL distanced itself from the proposal, citing international sanctions on Russian hockey due to geopolitical tensions following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Karnataka reclaims land HDK, relatives 'encroached on'
content: Karnataka's revenue department repossessed 14 acres of contested land in Ramanagara district from Union minister HD Kumaraswamy and his relatives. The action followed a High Court order prompting officials to move swiftly. Kumaraswamy claims the action is politically motivated and insists he purchased the land legally 40 years ago.

title: Taylor Swift skips iHeartRadio Music Awards, enjoys private time with Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift takes a break from the limelight after a record-breaking Eras Tour and releases a double album. She spends her time with Travis Kelce, skipping the 2025 iHeartRadio Music Awards, much to fans' disappointment. Swift stays productive, preparing for future projects.

title: 3 sentenced to death for '81 UP Dalit massacre
content: A special court in Uttar Pradesh sentenced three men to death for the 1981 Dehuli massacre, where 24 Dalits were killed. The brutal crime was considered exceptionally heinous and warranted the death penalty. Despite the long trial period, evidence led to their conviction. Survivors expressed relief but sought protection and support for rebuilding their lives.

title: 'Want fair peace for Ukraine, India has a key role to play': Sweden foreign min
content: Sweden's foreign minister, Maria Malmer Stenergard, emphasizes the importance of democracies uniting to uphold a rules-based order in both Ukraine and the Indo-Pacific. Stenergard also discusses Sweden's defence cooperation with India and their commitment to NATO while addressing security concerns related to China and Russia.

title: Rapp-7 nuclear-power plant connected to northern grid
content: India's nuclear programme achieved a major milestone as the Rajasthan Atomic Power Station's seventh unit was connected to the northern grid. With the operation of 25 reactors and 13,100 MW capacity under construction, the indigenous 700 MW PHWR series plays a crucial role in reaching a goal of 100 GW by 2047.

title: Omar Abdullah claims asset-split ‘bias’ against J&K, vows talks
content: Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed concern over the unfair distribution of assets following the bifurcation of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh in 2019. Omar emphasized resolving asset disputes amicably, avoiding prolonged court battles like Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. The J&K government is working on fair asset distribution, particularly in Delhi and Chandigarh, to ensure both regions benefit equally.

title: Woman pilgrim held with loaded pistol at Vaishno Devi, booked
content: A woman pilgrim, Jyoti Gupta, was arrested near the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi shrine in Jammu & Kashmir after being found with a loaded pistol and expired license. Another pilgrim, Sanjay Singh, was caught with cartridges. Security is tight due to past terrorist attacks. An investigation is underway.

title: Fire breaks out at Rajouri hospital, prompt evacuation prevents casualty
content: A fire broke out at the Rajouri Government Medical College and Hospital's basement, leading to an evacuation of the upper floors. Prompt action by staff, volunteers, and firefighters ensured the flames were controlled before spreading. Authorities are investigating the lack of a fire safety system and the cause of the incident.

title: 6 Supreme Court judges to visit restive Manipur this weekend
content: Six Supreme Court judges, including Justice B R Gavai, will visit Manipur to inquire about relief efforts and legal aid in camps amidst ongoing strife. The visit also marks the 20th establishment day of Manipur High Court, which was previously a bench of Gauhati HC.

title: Longest illegal occupation of territory since WWII in J&K: Jaishankar
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar criticized the selective application of international rules on sovereignty, citing J&K as an example where an invasion was turned into a dispute. He highlighted the unfair treatment of smaller countries and the inconsistent responses to military regimes in Myanmar and Pakistan, stressing the need for a fairer global order.

title: Srinagar resident arrested for extremist propaganda on social media
content: J&K Police's counter intelligence wing has arrested Showkat Ahmad Dar for running a radical social media handle that disseminated extremist content. Dar, who glorified terrorism and incited anti-national sentiments, was previously detained for similar activities, highlighting law enforcement's effort to curb online radicalisation.

title: Govt: 68 lakh cancer cases treated under PMJAY, 76% of them in rural areas
content: Over 68 lakh cancer treatments under the Ayushman Bharat scheme, valued at over Rs 13,000 crore, have been performed, with 76% in rural areas. 37 specific packages for targeted therapies like chemotherapy are included. Those below the poverty line may receive up to Rs 15 lakh assistance. The government aims to set up 200 daycare cancer centres by 2025-26.

title: Under opposition fire, Omar govt orders magisterial probe into Gujjar brothers’ deaths
content: J&K's National Conference government has announced a magisterial probe into the deaths of two Gujjar brothers found in Kulgam after a month-long disappearance. Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Choudhary stated the government would seek a judicial inquiry as requested by the families of the deceased.

title: Will Jayson Tatum play tonight against the Brooklyn Nets?
content: The Boston Celtics face the Brooklyn Nets on March 18, with star forward Jayson Tatum's knee injury status questionable. Tatum's 27.1 points per game are crucial, especially with Jaylen Brown out. The Celtics, at 49-19, rely heavily on Tatum's contributions in scoring, rebounds, and three-pointers. The game tips off at 7:30 p.m. ET.

title: Pakistan should vacate illegally occupied Indian areas: MEA
content: India has responded to Pakistan’s claims about Prime Minister Modi's comments on India-Pakistan relations, citing Pakistan's support for cross-border terrorism as the primary obstacle to regional peace. India reiterated that Pakistan should focus on vacating illegally occupied territories instead of spreading misinformation.

title: Hyderabad man dies by suicide; mother accuses wife of harassment
content: Mohammed Nawaz, a 35-year-old cameraperson from the Telugu film industry, died by suicide in Hyderabad due to alleged torture by his wife, Swetha Reddy Thada. Nawaz's mother claimed Swetha abused him, demanded money, and threatened him. The police are investigating the case based on the mother's complaint.

title: Din in Lok Sabha as Rahul Gandhi rises to speak after PM Modi, denied nod
content: Lok Sabha witnessed chaos after PM Modi's statement on Maha Kumbh, as Rahul Gandhi was denied permission to speak. The opposition protested, leading to adjournment. Rahul supported the PM's statement but noted Modi's omission of homage to stampede victims, criticizing the decision to silence him in the House.

title: Investors wealthier by Rs 8.67 L cr in 2 days - Why markets are rising
content: BSE Sensex and Nifty50 indices saw significant rallies, with Sensex rising by 1,131 points and Nifty50 by 326 points on Tuesday. Key factors driving the rally were global market cues, China's economic stimulus, and positive technical indicators.

title: Ukraine war or Indo-Pacific, India & EU must stick together: Sweden minister
content: Sweden's Foreign Minister Maria Malmer Stenergard emphasized the importance of democracies upholding a rules-based order, particularly in the Indo-Pacific where China poses challenges. Sweden supports India's Make in India initiative, contributing through defence cooperation. She backed Nato and discussed potential India-EU FTA benefits, highlighting India's vital role in maintaining global peace and security.

title: IPL 2025: Punjab Kings Team Preview - SWOT Analysis and Best XI
content: Punjab Kings have appointed Shreyas Iyer as their captain for IPL 2025 and revamped their squad. They have retained only two players and introduced several new faces. With a mix of explosive batting and strong bowling, they aim to finally secure their first IPL title. Their balance of power and strategy looks promising for the upcoming season.

title: US, France squabble over Statue of Liberty
content: The Trump White House received backlash for suggesting France should be grateful for U.S. help in WWII after a French politician suggested the U.S. return the Statue of Liberty. Responses highlighted France's crucial role in America's independence, the German defeat by Russia, and French support for American freedom over Indian aid against the British.

title: After Muslim MLAs remark, Suvendu raises pitch against TMC over Ram Navami
content: West Bengal BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticizes the Trinamool government, claiming that Hindus will resist any attempt to stop Ram Navami celebrations and accusing Mamata Banerjee of appeasing a particular community. This comes amid heightened tensions and allegations of violence during Holi in the state.

title: IPL 2025: KKR vs LSG match at Eden Gardens likely to be rescheduled
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' match against Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 may be rescheduled due to Ram Navami security concerns. The Cricket Association of Bengal president confirmed police cannot provide protection. A similar rescheduling occurred last year. CAB has informed BCCI and is awaiting a final decision. The 2025 IPL season begins on March 22 at Eden Gardens.

title: 'Don't listen to him': Did Putin keep Trump waiting for high-stakes call?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin delayed a scheduled call with US President Donald Trump to attend a conference in Moscow. Despite the delay, the two leaders discussed a potential 30-day ceasefire plan in Ukraine, with Putin agreeing to temporarily halt strikes on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.

title: No one going to steal your Statue of Liberty: French politician's 10-point clarification
content: "No one, of course, will come and steal the Statue of Liberty. The statue is yours. But what it embodies belongs to everyone. And if the free world no longer interests your government, then we will take up the torch, here in Europe," Glucksmann said adding that he's petrified by the Trump administration and its siding with Russia in the Ukraine war.

title: Sunita Williams smiles, waves after returning to Earth
content: Sunita Williams, Nasa astronaut, returned to Earth after a nine-month stay on the International Space Station. She arrived with fellow astronauts Butch Wilmore and Nick Hague, and cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov. Williams' mission was extended due to issues with Boeing’s Starliner capsule. She set a record for the most spacewalking time for a female astronaut.

title: Why did Netanyahu end the Gaza ceasefire?
content: Both Israel and the U.S. blame the renewed hostilities on Hamas’ refusal to release more hostages before negotiations on ending the war proceed — which was not part of the ceasefire agreement

title: New Zealand PM says looking forward to ink FTA with India in 60 days
content: India and New Zealand began negotiating the Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement (CECA) in April 2010 to boost trade in goods, services, and investment. However, after nine rounds of discussions, the talks stalled in 2015

title: Karnataka reports 12 deepfake-related cybercrime cases in two years
content: The use of deepfake videos to mislead social media users has been on the rise in Karnataka, raising concerns over the potential misuse of artificial intelligence

title: Astronaut Sunita Williams' ancestral village in Gujarat celebrates her safe return to Earth
content: The celebrations began after the successful splashdown of the Dragon spacecraft, which brought Sunita Williams back to Earth along with Crew-9 members Butch Wilmore, Nick Hague, and Russian cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov

title: Govt. urged to speed up investigation into building number scam
content: Kozhikode Corporation unable to take action against culprits as the investigation is incomplete, says report submitted by the secretary

title: ₹590-crore second-phase development of Vyttila Mobility Hub in doldrums
content: Delay in finalising development works attributed to inability of VMHS to seek loan; faced with commuter ire and public criticism over slack upkeep of premises, the society readies ₹10-crore project to renovate existing infrastructure at the hub

title: Spend more on healthcare, Rajya Sabha MPs tell Centre
content: Budget allocation for health has dipped in last seven years, says DMK MP Tiruchi Siva; says Centre should focus on uniform population control before delimitation; life expectancy has improved, says BJP MP Bhagawat Karad

title: Judicial probe will be initiated into Kulgam deaths, says J&K Deputy Chief Minister
content: Deputy Chief Minister Surinder Chowdhary, along with other officials, visited the victims’ families in Kulgam’s Devsar area

title: Trade unions to stage strike on May 20 against labour codes
content: A declaration adopted at a convention of labour unions said that in its third term, the Narendra Modi-led NDA government has become atrociously desperate to push through “corporate servile policy machinations” on the toiling populace.

title: Tamil Nadu government re-designates its Additional Advocates General
content: AAG J. Ravindran has been accommodated in the sixth position among 11 AAGs and given additional responsibility of coordination between the government and the judiciary

title: Railways Demand for Grants (2025-26) passed in Lok Sabha amid noisy protests
content: Union Minister Vaishnaw highlighted the decrease in railway accident rate and the relative affordability of tickets; called on CMs to ease land aquisition

title: Congress top brass confer on ways to strengthen district committees
content: Sources said the top brass of the party discussed a report by Mukul Wasnik on empowering the DCCs. Some key suggestions included consulting DCCs on important political developments, five-year terms for DCC presidents, not allowing DCC chiefs to contest elections for three years, and so on

title: Supreme Court judges to visit Manipur relief camps on March 22
content: The visit by the judges’ team headed by Justice B.R. Gavai highlights the ongoing need for legal and humanitarian assistance to affected communities

title: Maharashtra CM calls Nagpur violence pre-planned, Opposition asks Fadnavis to resign
content: Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde calls the incident a ‘conspiracy’; CM Fadnavis claims that the recently released film Chhaava instigated people’s sentiments against Mughal ruler Aurangzeb leading to the arson

title: Pact signed for using Parliament data to train indigenous AI model: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Parliament dataset will be a very good resource for training our model, similarly Doordarshan and All India Radio are other sources where large datasets are available, says Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Pakistan should vacate Indian territory under its illegal and forcible occupation: MEA
content: Islamabad had accused India of ‘fomenting terrorism in Pakistan’ and of ‘state sanctioned oppression’ in Jammu and Kashmir

title: Prayers on lips, celebrations on ground: Sunita Williams' ancestral Gujarat village plans 'Deepavali'
content: Jhulasan village in Mehsana district, known as the ancestral home of Sunita Williams' father, Deepak Pandya, is alive with excitement

title: Tripura Opposition wants Minister removed for ‘derogatory’ remarks
content: CPI(M) leader Jitendra Chaudhury said Fisheries Minister Sudhangshu Das accused several political parties of endorsing the brutality of Mughal Emperor Aurangzeb

title: How a ‘cine extra’ from Bangalore, who struck at schools and hostels in Madras, was arrested
content: Between September 4, 1962 and November 6, 1963, a series of daytime burglaries occurred in Madras. The police were left in the lurch as the fingerprints did not match. On January 5, 1964, Krishnappa was arrested in Kodambakkam after a lengthy investigation. He admitted to have been involved in all the 27 break-ins during 14 months

title: When Madras High Court was approached ‘in the absence’ of a Council of Ministers
content: While being hospitalised in the U.S., MGR led the AIADMK to a record victory in the 1984 Assembly election. Immediately after he formed his government in February 1985, two petitions argued that while filing nomination from hospital, a candidate should take his oath before a medical practitioner, not before a consular agent as MGR did

title: Let’s Talk series as part of Kochi-Muziris Biennale 2025-26 begins
content: Programme marks beginning of a series of public conversations that will travel across Kerala in the lead-up to the sixth edition of KMB 2025-26

title: Nagpur violence: We are ascertaining whether there was a mastermind, says Police Commissioner
content: Till the imposition of curfew, people will be able to step out for essential services only, says Ravinder Singal; he adds that police has imposed Section 307 where ‘one of our senior officials was attacked by an axe’

title: Man held for illegal mining of sand in Tirupattur
content: The team patrolled the area including an irrigation tank, open government land and riverbed after repeated complaints of illegal sand theft; Tirupattur SP Sheya Gupta has formed additional teams to intensify patrolling in the district to prevent illegal mining of sand from lakes and Palar river

title: Burglar who broke into Telangana MP DK Aruna’s residence nabbed
content: Investigation revealed that Akram had a history of involvement in similar offences with at least 17 cases booked against him in Delhi between 2017-2024

title: ‘Hyderabad faced third worst winter pollution in country’
content: The Industrial Development Area of Pashamylaram was the most polluted location among all in the three south Indian mega cities, with a seasonal average of 62 µg/m³

title: Union Finance Minister’s remarks about Kerala in Rajya Sabha misleading: Sivankutty
content: State Labour Minister says work conditions in Kerala much better after Ms. Sitharaman spoke of alleged impact of communism on industry in the State

title: Mirth, merriment fill IGMC stadium during legislators’ sports meet in Andhra Pradesh
content: Assembly Speaker Ch. Ayyanna Patrudu inaugurates the competitions; MLAs and MLCs participate in cricket, throwball, badminton, tug of war and volleyball competitions on Day 1 of three-day tourney

title: Bombay HC refuses to interfere in lower court order staying Maharashtra Minister’s conviction
content: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister Manikrao Kokate’s advocate opposed the petitions and said they are not maintainable as the petitioner was not a complainant in the case, and hence has no locus standi

title: Jadavpur University: One student arrested in connection with March 1 violence
content: Bengal Governor C.V. Ananda Bose says Jadavpur University VC should take a call on having a campus police outpost

title: Cape Town explores tech, tourism ties with Karnataka
content: Alderman James Vos met Priyank Kharge, Minister of IT&; BT, to discuss collaboration in technology, business process outsourcing (BPO), and tourism

title: Siddaramaiah challenges BJP to urge Centre to bring law on the lines of SCSP-TSP Act
content: During two-hour reply marked by heated exchanges between the Opposition and Treasury benches, Siddaramaiah listed out steps taken by his government for SC/ST welfare

title: BJP warns of Pakistan situation’s spillover into Jammu, asks security forces to stay alert
content: The BJP said that PM Modi’s initiates towards a peace process with Pakistan were responded by Pakistan launching a proxy war

title: Influence of Ramayana has spread beyond Indian subcontinent, says Union Minister Shekhawat
content: Gajendra Singh Shekhawat inaugurates a State-wide initiative to promote Kamba Ramayana - one of the most significant works in Tamil literature — by the South Zone Cultural Centre (SZCC).

title: Ramesh Chennithala seeks to be impleaded in PIL for rules to eradicate ragging from educational institutions
content: MLA says political patronage extended to students is a major factor contributing to the rise in ragging incidents and drug use

title: Youth told to take part in nation building by upholding Constitutional values
content: ‘Caste, crime and corruption are the cancers facing the country and they can be uprooted only when the youth come forward to fight them’

title: ECI sets the ball rolling on linking voter ID card with Aadhaar
content: Congress says EC must consult all political parties/stakeholders and assure them that “there are sufficient guardrails to not deny a single eligible voter the right to vote”

title: Bomb threat sparks panic at Thiruvananthapuram Collectorate, leading to unlikely bee attack
content: City Police act swiftly after receiving an email around 2 p.m. claiming that RDX had been planted in pipes within the Collectorate

title: Operation D-Hunt sees 365 cases and 387 arrests in three weeks in Thrissur
content: Among 365 cases, three involved commercial quantities, eight were medium quantity cases, and 29 cases involved small quantities

title: Only one woman cadet from Karnataka undergoing training in NDA
content: The first batch of women cadets joined NDA in August, 2022, and so far 126 cadets have joined the joint defence service training academy of the Indian armed forces

title: HC quashes POCSO case against headteacher
content: The headteacher was booked under the POCSO Act for not informing the police about the commission of the offence

title: Accusing CM of failing to keep his word, ASHAs seek ₹10,000 honorarium
content: Accredited Social Health Activists stage a huge demonstration in front of the Deputy Commissioner’s office in Haveri

title: AISF opposes closure of IIT Medical Academy in B.R. Ambedkar campus
content: The students demand that they be allowed to continue in the same campus at least for this academic year

title: Relatives demand probe into death of Thrissur student in Scotland
content: Body of Ebel Tharayil was found on railway tracks in Scotland on March 12. Family says there is no reason for Ebel to end his life

title: ₹1,186.84 crore due from Union government for school education, says Kerala Minister
content: The Centre had withheld the State’s due share for not signing the PM SHRI agreement, says General Education V. Sivankutty

title: Nearly 50% of assets under encroachment in Andhra Pradesh, says Waqf Board Chairman Abdul Azeez
content: Around 30,000 acres of land that is free from encroachment will be leased out through public auction, and the funds accrued thus will be used for the uplift of the community, he says

title: Meenachil river project will not adversely impact supply from Muvattupuzha: Roshy Augustine
content: Project aims to connect the Muvattupuzha and Meenachil basins and ensure a stable water supply for Kottayam

title: Centenary of Mahatma Gandhi’s first visit to Thrissur observed
content: Call to shape our thoughts, words, and actions in accordance with Gandhi’s principles so as to overcome the severe crises the world faces today

title: Indiana names WVU's DeVries as new head coach
content: The Indiana Hoosiers have hired West Virginia's Darian DeVries as new head coach of the men's basketball program, the school announced Tuesday.

title: Kupp ready for his 'new adventure' with Seahawks
content: Seattle wide receiver Cooper Kupp, 31, displayed his Seahawks jersey on Tuesday, telling reporters that he's excited as he steps "into this new adventure, this new place, this new chapter in my career" following a standout run with the Los Angeles Rams.

title: Alabama St. wins thriller with own spin on Hail Mary
content: Amarr Knox's layup with a second left lifted Alabama State to its first NCAA tournament win Tuesday night, 70-68 over Saint Francis in a matchup of No. 16 seeds in the First Four.

title: Steelers' Heyward fed up waiting on Rodgers
content: Steelers defensive tackle Cameron Heyward said on his podcast Tuesday that he has no plans to recruit Aaron Rodgers and that he just wants Pittsburgh's quarterback situation settled.

title: Poch: 'Big mistake' for USMNT to focus on politics
content: U.S. men's national team coach Mauricio Pochettino dismissed the political overtones surrounding the Concacaf Nations League finals, calling it a "big mistake" for his team to discuss politics.

title: All smiles, Bengals' Chase, Higgins eye fresh goal
content: The Bengals held a joint news conference Tuesday in the wake of their star receivers Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins signing four-year contract extensions.

title: Source: Hardman gets one-year deal from Packers
content: Mecole Hardman, 27, a veteran wide receiver and return specialist, is signing with Green Bay on a one-year deal, a source told ESPN's Jeremy Fowler, and though he's not the No. 1 receiver the Packers might be lacking, he does add speed to the positions.

title: Trump, Putin float NHL-KHL games; league mum
content: President Donald Trump supported President Vladimir Putin's idea to organize hockey games between the U.S. and Russia during their phone call on Tuesday. In a statement, the NHL said it has no comment.

title: Giant Killers: Predicting 10 women's March Madness early-round upsets
content: Looking for upsets in the women's March Madness bracket? Harvard, Vanderbilt and South Dakota State are looking to hang around.

title: 'It's Pop's decision. He's earned that': Inside Gregg Popovich's fight to return to the sideline
content: For the first time in 30 years, the legendary coach has been on a different sideline, battling to return to what he once was. This is the story of his season -- and what might come next for the proud franchise he leads.

title: 'I didn't know Kyle Tucker spoke': 'Silent assassin' could be MLB's next $400 million star
content: The new Cubs outfielder is still the same slugger he was back when he was breaking records in high school.

title: NFL experts debate free agency: What were the biggest head-scratcher signings?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the best (Davante Adams?) and worst moves (Javon Kinlaw?) from NFL free agency.

title: NHL insiders debate playoff bubble teams, Stanley Cup finalists, MVP picks
content: Which team on the fringe is getting in? And which is under the most pressure in the final month? Who wins the Hart Trophy?

title: Predicting the Premier League stretch, from Champions League race to relegation
content: With the just nine matchdays left in the 2024-25 Premier League season, how will things shake out for Arsenal, Man City, Chelsea and others? Let's predict how the final stretch plays out.

title: When can Liverpool win the Premier League title?
content: Liverpool have built up a 12-point lead at the top of the table. How early could the championship be sealed?

title: Crowning a champion in our 64-team college football bracket
content: From the Sweet 16 to the Final Four, we determine who is left standing at the end of our football version of March Madness.

title: You've signed a one-of-a-kind freshman in Cooper Flagg. Now what? Here's how Duke built a contender around its prized recruit
content: In an era when teams are incentivized to build around experience, the Blue Devils built a contender with youth.

title: Poch: USMNT can be world's best in 5 or 10 years
content: Mauricio Pochettino has said the U.S. men's national team can be the best in the world within "five or 10 years" due to the growth and investment in soccer in the country.

title: Robinson among USMNT trio ruled out for CNL
content: The U.S. men's national team will be without Real Betis midfielder Johnny Cardoso, Fulham defender Antonee Robinson and Celtic center back Auston Trusty for the Concacaf Nations League finals.

title: Cavallo reveals daily death threats for being gay
content: Josh Cavallo, men's football's first openly gay active player, said he struggles encourage other players to come out due to the sport's "toxic" environment.

title: U.S. Open Cup prize money doubles to record $1M
content: U.S. Soccer announced Tuesday it will be doubling the prize money for the 2025 U.S. Open Cup, reaching a record-breaking $1 million in an effort to continue building interest in the tournament.

title: Madrid frustrate Arsenal to get UWCL 1st-leg win
content: Real Madrid frustrated Arsenal to secure a 2-0 win in the first leg of the Champions League quarterfinals in Madrid.

title: CONMEBOL prez sorry for Tarzan's chimp remark
content: Alejandro Domínguez, the president of South American soccer body CONMEBOL, apologized Tuesday for his remarks the previous day comparing Brazilian clubs to a chimpanzee from Tarzan films.

title: Courtois hopes Belgium exile drama now over
content: Belgium goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois said he has poken to teammates about his lengthy exile from the national side.

title: Denver's new NWSL team reveals stadium plans
content: The ownership group for Denver's NWSL expansion team, which begins play in 2026, announced plans to build a 14,500-seat stadium on Tuesday.

title: College softball rankings: The Top 25 teams after Week 6
content: Is Oklahoma still No. 1? Which team dropped out this week? Here's the updated college softball Top 25 poll for Week 6.

title: Men's March Madness storylines: Cooper Flagg's impact and SEC dominance
content: How has the industry reacted to the bracket? There's plenty at stake in one of the year's biggest betting events.

title: Takeaways from Indian Wells -- and what they mean for Miami Open
content: Will Djokovic and Swiatek turn their season around? Can Andreeva continue her incredible run? The biggest questions as the Miami Open begins.

title: What would it take for Wrexham to reach Premier League from League 1?
content: Wrexham's rise from nonleague has truly been the stuff of Hollywood legend -- no surprise given their owners. But can they now actually get to the Premier League from here?

title: Unretired and unbeaten: Wojciech Szczesny's fairy-tale return to football
content: Szczesny retired just over 200 days ago. Now, he's back with Barcelona and undefeated in 17 appearances.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea want out of Jadon Sancho deal
content: Will Chelsea's on-loan winger Jadon Sancho be heading back to Manchester United? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Flyweight has a new No. 1
content: Kenoshiro Teraji takes Seigo Yuri Akui's top spot at flyweight after a comeback TKO win. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: WNBA trade grades: Did the defending champion Liberty get even better in trade for Cloud?
content: Natasha Cloud gives New York another skilled distributor and a stronger defense, while Connecticut gains two first-round picks to help its rebuild.

title: Six March Madness stars to watch
content: Eric Moody breaks down which players fantasy managers should keep an eye on during the 2025 Women's NCAA tournament.

title: Sunita Williams Smiles, Waves As She Returns Home After 286 Days In Space
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore have returned home after their eight-day mission to the International Space Station turned into a nine-month-long stay.

title: Live: Comfortable Clothes, 45-Day Rehabilitation For Sunita Williams, Others
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, after an unexpected stay at the International Space Station (ISS) for more than nine months, have returned to Earth and splashed down off the coast of the American state of Florida early on Wednesday.

title: Video: Dolphins Say Hi To Sunita Williams, Welcome Astronaut Back Home
content: Astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore returned to Earth after an eight-day mission turned into a nine-month ordeal in space.

title: First Visuals Of Sunita Williams On Earth After 9-Month Stay In Space
content: NASA astronaut and Crew-9 commander Nick Hague was the first to emerge from the Dragon capsule with the help of ground crew, almost an hour after the Dragon capsule splashed down off the Florida coast.

title: "Promise Made, Promise Kept": White House On Sunita Williams' Return
content: Earlier in January, President Trump had asked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk to "go get" the two astronauts home.

title: "Egg On My Face": Shashi Tharoor on Opposing India's Stance On Ukraine War
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor conceded that he was left with "egg on his face" in opposing India's stance when the Russia-Ukraine war broke out and said the country is now in a position where it can make a difference.

title: "Someone Who Lived 300 Years Ago...": Uddhav Thackeray On Aurangzeb Row
content: Amid violence in Maharashtra's Nagpur - over demands Mughal ruler Aurangzeb's grave be moved out of the state - ex-Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray questioned the need for a face-off, pointing out the Mughal emperor had died over 300 years ago.

title: Puffy Head, Chicken Legs: How Sunita Williams Will Readjust To Gravity
content: Crew-9 astronauts face health implications on their return after nine months in space and will undergo a 45-day rehabilitation programme.

title: Watch: Moment Sunita Williams' Spacecraft Splashed Down Off Florida Coast
content: Four parachutes deployed as SpaceX's Dragon splashed down in the sea off US' Florida, marking the return of Sunita Williams and other members of the Crew-9 to Earth

title: Lasting Peace, And A Condition: What Both Sides Said On Trump-Putin Call
content: During an over two-hour call, US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin agreed that the war in Ukraine "needs to end with a lasting peace", the White House said on Tuesday.

title: 'Security Issue' Looms Over IPL Match In Kolkata, Set To Be Rescheduled
content: Kolkata Knight Riders' IPL home match against Lucknow Super Giants on April 6 at Eden Gardens is likely to be rescheduled.

title: "Prisoner Exchange Will Be...": Kremlin's Full Statement On Trump-Putin Call
content: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin spoke for over two hours during a phone call, discussing ways to end the ongoing war in Ukraine and ways to establish "lasting peace".

title: "Virat Needs To Be The Captain Of...": De Villiers' Honest Advice To RCB
content: South Africa batting great AB de Villiers believes Virat Kohli should focus on playing smart cricket and continue controlling the game this season.

title: Fake Blood, Sharp Weapon: Reel Shoot Sparks Panic In Karnataka, 2 Arrested
content: An attempt to film a murder scene for an Instagram reel triggered panic in Karnataka's Kalaburagi late on Monday, police on Tuesday said, adding that two people have been arrested.

content: The TOI Science Desk stands as an inquisitive team of journalists, ceaselessly delving into the realms of discovery to curate a captivating collection of news, features, and articles from the vast and ever-evolving world of science for the readers of The Times of India. Consider us your scientific companion, delivering a daily dose of wonder and enlightenment. Whether it's the intricacies of genetic engineering, the marvels of space exploration, or the latest in artificial intelligence, the TOI Science Desk ensures you stay connected to the pulse of the scientific world. At the TOI Science Desk, we are not just reporters; we are storytellers of scientific narratives. We are committed to demystifying the intricacies of science, making it accessible and engaging for readers of all backgrounds.
